snippet: The former world champion Garry Kasparov and Magnus Carlsen, the current No. 1 player in the world, offer clinics to help less experienced players improved their games.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column notes that former world champion Garry Kasparov and Magnus Carlsen, the current number one player in the world, offer clinics to help less experienced players improve their games.
lead_paragraph: The former world champion Garry Kasparov and Magnus Carlsen, the current No. 1 player in the world, offer clinics to help less experienced players improved their games.

headline.seo: Chess: Garry Kasparov’s and Magnus Carlsen’s Clinics
headline.main: Learning the Game From Two of the Best
